UserProfile.description: API response format for user profile

UpdateProfileDto.description:
DTO for updating user profile

Used to update user profile information. All fields are optional - only
provided fields will be updated. The user_id is automatically extracted
from the authentication token.

username.description: Username (3-30 characters, only for initial profile creation)

aboutMe.example: I'm a professional musician with 10 years of experience...

phoneNumber.description: Phone number (4-15 digits, stored as bigint)

lookingFor.description: Types of connections user is looking for

UserSocialMediaResponse.description: API response format for user social media links

UpdateSocialMediaDto.description: DTO for updating user social media links

UserFaqResponse.description: API response format for user FAQ answer with question

example.question: What genres do you specialize in?
example.answer: I specialize in electronic and ambient music

UpsertFaqDto.description: DTO for creating/updating user FAQ answer

UserLookingForResponse.description: API response format for user's "looking for" preferences

FaqQuestionResponse.description: API response format for FAQ question

example.question: What genres do you specialize in?

SignedUrlResponse.description:
API response format for signed upload URL

Returns a temporary signed URL that allows direct client uploads to Supabase Storage.
The client uses this URL to upload files directly, bypassing the backend.

SignedUrlRequestDto.description:
DTO for requesting a signed upload URL

Used to generate a temporary signed URL for direct client uploads to Supabase Storage.
The client will use this signed URL to upload files directly, bypassing the backend.

fileName.description: Original file name (used to determine file extension)

fileType.description: MIME type of the file (used for validation)

uploadType.description: Upload type: "post" for post media, "avatar" for profile pictures

UserSearchResult.description: Search result for a user (from search_people)

CollaborationSearchResult.description: Search result for a collaboration request (from search_collaborations)

example.title: Mixing & Mastering
example.description: Professional audio mixing and mastering services

ForYouSearchResult.description:
Search result for "For You" tab (from search_for_you)
Polymorphic result that can be a user, collaboration, service, or tag

SearchResult.description: Union type for all search results

SearchResponse.description: API response format for search results

RecentSearch.description: API response format for a recent search entry

SaveRecentSearchDto.description:
DTO for saving a recent search

Used when a user performs a search to save it to their history

tab.description: Search tab where the search was performed

entityType.description: Optional entity type if user clicked through to a specific result

entityId.description: Optional entity ID if user clicked through to a specific result

ReviewResponse.description:
API response format for a user review
Represents a 5-star rating and review text for a user

Pick_ReviewInsert.Exclude_keyofReviewIns.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

CreateReviewDto.description:
DTO for creating a review

Used when writing a review for a user.
The reviewer_id is automatically extracted from the authentication token.

UpdateReviewDto.description:
DTO for updating a review

Used when editing your own review.

PostResponse.description:
API response format for a post with flattened relations
This is the camelCase version of PostRow (database format)
The mapper transforms PostRow (snake_case) → PostResponse (camelCase)

MediaItemDto.description: DTO for media items attached to posts

thumbnailUrl.description: Optional thumbnail URL for the media

Pick_PostInsert.Exclude_keyofPostInsert..description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

CreatePostBody.description:
DTO for creating a new post

Used when creating a post (note, request, or story). The author_id is
automatically extracted from the authentication token.

For "note" posts, you can include tags.
For "request" posts, you can include genres and paidOpportunity flag.
All post types can include media attachments and tagged users.

description.example: I'm looking for an experienced drummer to join our band...

location.description: Optional location where the post is relevant

paidOpportunity.description: Whether this is a paid opportunity (only for "request" type posts)

taggedUsers.description: Array of user IDs to tag in the post

example.title: My First Post
example.description: This is a detailed description of my post

CommentResponse.description:
API response format for a comment
Represents a comment on a post with author information

NotificationResponse.description:
API response format for a notification
Represents a notification with actor information

UpdateNotificationDto.description:
DTO for updating a notification

Used when marking a notification as read or unread.

MetadataItem.description: API response format for metadata item

MetadataResponse.description:
API response format for metadata endpoint
Returns all available tags, genres, and artists organized by type

MessageResponse.description:
API response format for a message
Represents a message in a conversation with sender info and optional reply

MessageReadReceiptResponse.description: API response format for a message read receipt

PaginatedMessagesResponse.description:
API response format for paginated messages
Used by GET /messages/:conversationId endpoint

FeedPostResponse.description:
API response format for a post in the feed
Extends PostResponse with engagement data and user interaction state

ConversationParticipantResponse.description: API response format for a conversation participant

ConversationResponse.description:
API response format for a conversation
Represents a direct message or group conversation

ConnectionStatus.description: Status of a connection request between two users

Connection.description:
API response format for a connection request
Represents a connection request between two users with requester/recipient profiles

CreateConnectionRequestDto.description:
DTO for creating a connection request

Used when sending a connection request to another user.
The requester_id is automatically extracted from the authentication token.

recipientId.description: The ID of the user to send the connection request to (UUID format)

UpdateConnectionRequestDto.description:
DTO for updating a connection request status

Used when accepting or rejecting a connection request.
Only the recipient can update the status.

status.description: The new status for the connection request

Pick_CommentInsert.Exclude_keyofCommentI.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_CommentInsert.author_id-or-created_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

CreateCommentDto.description:
DTO for creating a comment

Used when creating a comment on a post. The author_id is automatically
extracted from the authentication token.

postId.description: The ID of the post to comment on (UUID format)

content.example: Great post! Looking forward to collaborating.

parentId.description:
Optional parent comment ID for nested replies (UUID format)
If provided, this comment will be a reply to the parent comment

example.content: Great post! Looking forward to collaborating.

UpdateCommentDto.description:
DTO for updating a comment

Used when updating an existing comment. Only the content can be updated.

CollaborationResponse.description:
API response format for a user collaboration
Represents a past collaboration between two users

Pick_CollaborationInsert.Exclude_keyofCo.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

CreateCollaborationDto.description:
DTO for creating a collaboration

Represents a past collaboration between the authenticated user and another user.
The description is optional and limited to 200 characters.

description.description: Optional description of the collaboration (max 200 characters)
description.example: Worked together on a jazz album in 2023

collaboratorId.description: The ID of the user you collaborated with (UUID format)

example.description: Worked together on a jazz album in 2023

BookmarkResponse.description:
API response format for a bookmark
Includes the bookmark details and optional post information with author

Pick_BookmarkInsert.Exclude_keyofBookmar.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

CreateBookmarkDto.description:
DTO for creating a bookmark

Used when a user wants to bookmark a post for later reference.
The user_id is automatically extracted from the authentication token.

postId.description: The UUID of the post to bookmark

info.title: LineUp API
info.description: API documentation for the LineUp application

200.description: User profile (public or private based on authentication)

get.description:
Get user profile by username

Retrieves a user's profile information. Returns public profile data by default.
If authenticated and viewing your own profile, returns additional private fields
such as phone number, year of birth, etc.

Authentication is optional - endpoint can be accessed without a token for public profiles.

parameters.description: The username of the user to retrieve
parameters.name: username

put.description:
Update own profile

Updates the authenticated user's profile information. Only the profile owner
can update their own profile. All fields in the request body are optional -
only provided fields will be updated.

parameters.description: The username of the profile to update (must match authenticated user)
parameters.name: username

requestBody.description: The profile fields to update (all optional)

schema.description: The profile fields to update (all optional)

get.description:
Get user's social media links

Returns all social media platform links for the specified user.
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

parameters.description: The username of the user
parameters.name: username

put.description:
Update user's social media links

Updates the authenticated user's social media links.
Only the profile owner can update their own social media.

parameters.description: The username (must match authenticated user)
parameters.name: username

get.description:
Get user's FAQ answers

Returns all FAQ answers for the specified user with their corresponding questions.
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

parameters.description: The username of the user
parameters.name: username

post.description:
Create or update user's FAQ answer

Adds or updates an answer to an FAQ question for the authenticated user.
Only the profile owner can manage their own FAQ.

parameters.description: The username (must match authenticated user)
parameters.name: username

delete.description:
Delete user's FAQ answer

Removes an answer to an FAQ question for the authenticated user.
Only the profile owner can delete their own FAQ answers.

parameters.description: The username (must match authenticated user)
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The question ID to delete answer for
parameters.name: questionId

get.description:
Get what user is looking for

Returns the user's "looking for" preferences (connect, promote, find-band, find-services).
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

parameters.description: The username of the user
parameters.name: username

200.description: List of all active FAQ questions

get.description:
Get all available FAQ questions

Returns all active FAQ questions that users can answer on their profiles.
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

200.description: Signed URL and file path for direct client upload

post.description:
Generate a signed upload URL for direct client uploads

Returns a temporary signed URL that allows clients to upload files directly
to Supabase Storage, bypassing the backend. This improves scalability by
avoiding large file buffers in the Node.js server.

The client should:
1. Call this endpoint to get a signed URL
2. Upload the file directly to the signed URL using fetch/PUT
3. Use the returned filePath to construct the public URL
4. Include the public URL when creating posts or updating avatars

- **Images**: JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP
- **Videos**: MP4, WebM, QuickTime
- **Upload Types**: "post" (default) for post media, "avatar" for profile pictures

requestBody.description: Request body containing fileName, fileType, and optional uploadType

schema.description: Request body containing fileName, fileType, and optional uploadType

delete.description:
Delete a media file

Removes the file from Supabase Storage and deletes the media record from the database.
Only authenticated users can delete media.

parameters.description: The UUID of the media to delete
parameters.name: mediaId

200.description: Search results based on the selected tab

get.description:
Search for users, posts, or tags

Performs a search across different entity types based on the specified tab.
Returns polymorphic results that vary by tab type.

- **for_you**: Personalized results combining people and collaboration requests
- **people**: Search for users with filters (location, genres, looking for)
- **collaborations**: Search for collaboration request posts
- **services**: Search for services
- **tags**: Search for metadata (tags, genres, artists)
get.summary: Search across users, posts, services, and tags

parameters.description: Search query string
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Search tab: "for_you", "people", "collaborations", "services", or "tags" (default: "for_you")
parameters.name: tab

parameters.description: Filter by location
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: Filter by genres (array)
parameters.name: genres

parameters.description: Filter by looking for types (for people tab)
parameters.name: lookingFor

parameters.description: Filter for paid opportunities only (for collaborations tab)
parameters.name: paidOnly

parameters.description: Maximum number of results (1-100, default: 20)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset for pagination (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

get.description:
Get recent searches for the authenticated user

Returns the user's recent search history, ordered by most recent first.
Limited to the last 15 searches by default.

parameters.description: Maximum number of results (default: 15)
parameters.name: limit

post.description:
Save a recent search

Saves a search query to the user's recent search history.
Automatically deduplicates identical query+tab combinations.

delete.description:
Clear all recent searches

Removes all search entries from the user's recent search history.

Delete a specific recent search

Removes a single search entry from the user's recent search history.

parameters.description: The ID of the recent search to delete
parameters.name: id

200.description: Array of reviews with reviewer details

get.description:
Get all reviews for a user

Returns all reviews for a specific user with reviewer information.
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

parameters.description: The username of the user to retrieve reviews for
parameters.name: username

post.description:
Create a review for a user

Allows the authenticated user to write a review for another user.
Prevents self-reviews and duplicate reviews.

parameters.description: The username of the user being reviewed
parameters.name: username

requestBody.description: Review data including rating (1-5) and optional description

schema.description: Review data including rating (1-5) and optional description

get.description:
Get a review by ID

Returns a specific review with reviewer information.
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

parameters.description: The UUID of the review to retrieve
parameters.name: reviewId

patch.description:
Update a review

Updates the rating and/or description of a review.
Only the reviewer can update their own review.

parameters.description: The UUID of the review to update
parameters.name: reviewId

delete.description:
Delete a review

Permanently deletes a review.
Only the reviewer can delete their own review.

parameters.description: The UUID of the review to delete
parameters.name: reviewId

200.description: The created post with all related data (metadata, media, tagged users, author)

post.description:
Create a new post

Creates a new post (note, request, or story) with optional metadata, media,
and tagged users. The post is automatically associated with the authenticated user.

For "note" type posts, you can include tags.
For "request" type posts, you can include genres and paid_opportunity flag.
All post types can include media and tagged users.

requestBody.description: The post data including type, title, description, and optional fields

schema.description: The post data including type, title, description, and optional fields

get.description:
List posts with filters and pagination

Returns a paginated list of posts with optional filters.
Supports filtering by type, author, location, genres, tags, and paid opportunities.
Can optionally include engagement data (requires authentication).

Posts are public and can be viewed without authentication, but engagement data
(likes, comments, bookmarks) requires authentication.

parameters.description: Filter by post type: "note", "request", or "story"
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Filter by author user ID
parameters.name: authorId

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (ISO timestamp)
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Maximum number of posts to return (1-100, default: 20)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Whether to include engagement data (requires auth)
parameters.name: includeEngagement

parameters.description: Whether to include media in the response
parameters.name: includeMedia

parameters.description: Filter by genre IDs (array)
parameters.name: genreIds

parameters.description: Filter by tag names (array)
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: Filter by location
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: Filter for paid opportunities only
parameters.name: paidOnly

200.description: The post with all related data, optional comments, and optional engagement

get.description:
Get a single post by ID

Returns a single post with full details including author, metadata, media, and tagged users.
Can optionally include comments and engagement data (requires authentication).

Posts are public and can be viewed without authentication, but engagement data
(likes, comments, bookmarks) requires authentication.

parameters.description: The UUID of the post to retrieve
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Whether to include comments in the response
parameters.name: includeComments

parameters.description: Maximum number of comments to return (1-100, default: 50)
parameters.name: commentsLimit

200.description: The updated post with resolved status

post.description:
Resolve a request post

Marks a request post as resolved and archives it. Only the post author can resolve their own posts.
Resolved posts are excluded from the main feed but remain accessible via user's post history.

parameters.description: The UUID of the post to resolve
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Like a post

Adds a like from the authenticated user to the specified post.
If the post is already liked by the user, this is a no-op.

parameters.description: The UUID of the post to like
parameters.name: id

delete.description:
Unlike a post

Removes the like from the authenticated user for the specified post.

parameters.description: The UUID of the post to unlike
parameters.name: id

get.description:
Get notifications for the authenticated user

Returns notifications for the authenticated user with optional filters.
Supports filtering by type and unread status, with cursor-based pagination.
Archived notifications are excluded by default.

parameters.description: Filter by notification type
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: If true, only return unread notifications
parameters.name: unreadOnly

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (ISO timestamp)
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Maximum number of notifications to return (1-100, default: 50)
parameters.name: limit

get.description:
Get a notification by ID

Returns a specific notification with actor information.
Only the recipient can access their own notifications.

parameters.description: The UUID of the notification to retrieve
parameters.name: notificationId

patch.description:
Update a notification

Marks a notification as read or unread.
Only the recipient can update their own notifications.

parameters.description: The UUID of the notification to update
parameters.name: notificationId

delete.description:
Delete a notification

Permanently deletes a notification.
Only the recipient can delete their own notifications.

parameters.description: The UUID of the notification to delete
parameters.name: notificationId

200.description: Metadata grouped by type (tags, genres, artists)

get.description:
Get all metadata

Returns all tags, genres, and artists grouped by type.
Used for dropdowns, autocomplete, and tag/genre selectors.
This endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

200.description: Feed posts with pagination cursor, or recommendations array

get.description:
Get home feed

Returns feed content based on the specified component:
- "posts": Posts from users you follow (with pagination)
- "recommendations": Collaboration request recommendations
- "stories": Stories from followed users (coming soon)

Posts feed includes engagement data (likes, comments, bookmarks counts)
and user interaction state (hasLiked, hasBookmarked).

parameters.description: The feed component to fetch (default: "posts")
parameters.name: component

parameters.description: Cursor for pagination (ISO timestamp)
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return (1-50, default: 20)
parameters.name: limit

200.description: Array of connection requests (sent and received)

get.description:
Get all connection requests for the authenticated user

Returns both sent and received connection requests for the authenticated user.
Each request includes requester and recipient profile information.

post.description:
Create a connection request

Allows the authenticated user to send a connection request to another user.
The recipient must exist and there must not be an existing connection request.

requestBody.description: Connection request data including recipient ID

schema.description: Connection request data including recipient ID

200.description: Array of connection requests sent by the user

get.description:
Get connection requests sent by a user

Returns all connection requests sent by the specified user.
This endpoint can be accessed without authentication.
get.summary: Get sent connection requests by user

parameters.description: The UUID of the user to retrieve sent requests for
parameters.name: userId

200.description: Array of connection requests received by the user

get.description:
Get connection requests received by a user

Returns all connection requests received by the specified user.
This endpoint can be accessed without authentication.
get.summary: Get received connection requests by user

parameters.description: The UUID of the user to retrieve received requests for
parameters.name: userId

200.description: The connection if it exists, null otherwise

get.description:
Get connection status between the authenticated user and another user

Returns the connection if it exists (pending, accepted), null otherwise.
Rejected connections are not returned.
get.summary: Get connection status between two users

parameters.description: The UUID of the target user
parameters.name: targetUserId

200.description: Array of accepted connections for the user

get.description:
Get accepted connections for a specific user

Returns only accepted connections for the specified user.
This endpoint can be accessed without authentication.

parameters.description: The UUID of the user to retrieve accepted connections for
parameters.name: userId

put.description:
Update a connection request status

Allows the recipient to accept or reject a connection request.
Only the recipient can update the status, and only pending requests can be updated.
put.summary: Accept or reject a connection request

parameters.description: The UUID of the connection request to update
parameters.name: requestId

delete.description:
Delete a connection request

Removes a connection request. Only the requester can delete a pending request.

parameters.description: The UUID of the connection request to delete
parameters.name: requestId

200.description: Array of comments with author details

get.description:
Get all comments for a post

Returns all comments on a specific post, ordered by creation date (oldest first).
Each comment includes the author's profile information.

parameters.description: The UUID of the post to retrieve comments for
parameters.name: postId

200.description: Array of comments with author details

get.description:
Get all comments by a user

Returns all comments created by a specific user, ordered by creation date (newest first).
Each comment includes the author's profile information.

parameters.description: The UUID of the user to retrieve comments for
parameters.name: userId

200.description: The created comment with author details

post.description:
Create a comment on a post

Allows the authenticated user to create a comment on a post.
The post must exist and the comment content must be between 1 and 1000 characters.

requestBody.description: Comment data including post ID and content

schema.description: Comment data including post ID and content

put.description:
Update a comment

Allows the authenticated user to update their own comment.
Only the comment author can update their comment.

parameters.description: The UUID of the comment to update
parameters.name: commentId

delete.description:
Delete a comment

Removes a comment. Only the comment author can delete their own comment.

parameters.description: The UUID of the comment to delete
parameters.name: commentId

200.description: Array of collaborations with collaborator details

get.description:
Get all collaborations for the authenticated user

Returns a list of all collaborations where the authenticated user is involved.
Each collaboration includes the collaborator's profile information.

post.description:
Create a collaboration

Allows the authenticated user to record a past collaboration with another user.
The collaborator must exist and the collaboration must not already exist.

requestBody.description: Collaboration data including collaborator ID and optional description

schema.description: Collaboration data including collaborator ID and optional description

200.description: Array of collaborations with collaborator details

get.description:
Get collaborations for a specific user

Returns all collaborations for the specified user. This endpoint can be
accessed without authentication to view public collaboration information.

parameters.description: The UUID of the user to retrieve collaborations for
parameters.name: userId

delete.description:
Delete a collaboration

Removes a collaboration. Only the user who created the collaboration
can delete it.

parameters.description: The UUID of the collaboration to delete
parameters.name: collaborationId

200.description: Array of bookmarks with post details

get.description:
Get all bookmarks for the authenticated user

Returns a list of all bookmarks created by the authenticated user.
Each bookmark includes the post details and author information.

post.description:
Create a bookmark for a post

Allows the authenticated user to bookmark a post for later reference.
The post must exist and must not already be bookmarked by the user.

requestBody.description: The bookmark data containing the post ID to bookmark

schema.description: The bookmark data containing the post ID to bookmark

delete.description:
Remove a bookmark

Deletes a bookmark for a specific post. Only the user who created
the bookmark can remove it.

parameters.description: The UUID of the post to unbookmark
parameters.name: postId

get.description:
Check if a username is available

Returns availability status for real-time validation during registration.
Username must be between 3-30 characters to be considered valid.

parameters.description: Username to check for availability
parameters.name: username
